metadata.label: Physical description
metadata.value: Machine readable catalogue compatible with IIIF 2.0 Presentation API

metadata.label: Notes
metadata.value: All items have corresponding IIIF 2.0/3.0 manifests, which include internal references (such as sequences, canvases, and annotations) to provide more detailed structural and content information.  The seeAlso field should be parsed carefully, as it links to external, machine-readable descriptive metadata (e.g., in formats like XML, JSON, or RDF) or related IIIF resources for richer, domain-specific details suitable for indexing and aggregation.  Note that while IIIF 2.0 and 3.0 manifests share core concepts, version 3.0 introduces enhancements like mandatory arrays for multi-value properties (e.g., metadata, thumbnails) and renamed properties for better JavaScript compatibility (e.g., @id to id).  The primary priority of this indexing effort is the Machines collection; however, this catalog can also be used directly by humans for browsing and exploration.

metadata.label: Subjects
metadata.value: Travel, Life Styles, Politic, Culture, Art, Architecture, History, Geography, Archeology, Illuminated Manuscript, Quran, Photography, Calligraphy, Maps, Documentaries, Voyages, Exploration, Persia, Iran, GLAM, Libraries, Archives, Museums, Digital Collections, IIIF, RDF, FAIR, LOUD, LinkedArt

metadata.label: GLAM
metadata.value: Internet Archive, Gallica, QDL, Berlin, David Rumsey Collection, NLI, BULAC, INHA, RARA, LOC, Wellcome Collection, Leiden University, Biblissima, Princeton, e-codices, München Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, University of Edinburgh, SLUB Dresden, Harvard Art Museums, ARCA, Princeton, WaltersArt, Chester Beatty, Bodleian Libraries, Manchester University Library, Presbyterian Historical Society, LCDL, DUKE, NLS

en: An experimental catalogue for digital resources in various GLAMs related to the culture, art, architecture, voyages and sometimes historical events about the Persia(IRAN).
This catalogue is fully machine readable/consumable and intended to adhere IIIF 2.0 Presentation.
Accessing the full data required to multiple Request. The full data access model will be publishe soon.
Use it with care, The information in this list is changing periodically and in daily-based basis and may be subject to significant modification even in Data Models.
